div.head: R. C. GENT. IN COMMENDATION OF THIS BOOKE.

lg.l: PRowes the hand, and policie the head,
By which great kingdomes are both had and held,
Are well obserued, but are better read,
By them, in whom it is great States to weld.
For what is all that anie one obserues,
In that short time, while he hath iudgements eyes?
Or who is he, that in the state he serues,
Of euerie action sees the counsels wise?
Now if great men, great actions long to see,
VVho may with Scanderbeg the Great compare?
If in the like they will aduised bee,
Here both his doings and his counsels are.
And with one labour, noble mindes may reade,
Prowes for hand, and policie for head.
